name: Sriram V. Pemmaraju
content: Sriram Pemmaraju Sriram Pemmaraju Professor, Department of Computer Science, The University of Iowa Coordinates: 256 Macbride Hall, Department of Computer Science, The University of Iowa, Iowa City, IA 52242-1419 319 353 2956 (voice) sriram-pemmaraju@uiowa.edu Fall 2025 Office Hours: Mon 9:30-10:30, Thu 1:00-2:00, Fri 11:30-12:30 Research: I have a two-track research program. My primary research program is in theoretical computer science, more specifically in the foundations of distributed graph algorithms. Here I am interested in designing efficient distributed algorithms for graph problems in various models of distributed computing or showing that such efficient algorithms no not exist. I am also interested in exploring trade-offs between different resources used by distributed algorithms (e.g., rounds, messages, bandwidth, network topology, randomness, initial knowledge, etc.). My research in distributed graph algorithms has intersections with other areas in theoretical computer science such as approximation algorithms, combinatorial optimization, communication complexity, graph theory, information theory, and randomized algorithms. In addition, I am part of the interdisciplinary Computational Epidemiology Group at Iowa. As part of my work with this group, I work on problems related to disease-diffusion, disease-inference and disease-mitigation on contact networks. I design algorithmic solutions to these problems that have low-cost implementations in healthcare settings. A particular focus of our group is healthcare associated infections and we have been part of the CDC funded MInD Healthcare group. Openings for Spring and Fall 2026: I am looking for 1-2 PhD students in distributed graph algorithms and in computational epidemiology. Read on if you are interested...
